comment._content: "Ganna Walska (born Hanna Puacz on June 26, 1887 – March 2, 1984) was a Polish opera singer and garden enthusiast who created the Lotusland botanical gardens at her mansion in Montecito, California. She was married six times, four times to very wealthy husbands. The lavish promotion of her lackluster opera career by her fourth husband, Harold Fowler McCormick, inspired aspects of the screenplay for Citizen Kane." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ganna_Walska She married Harold McCormick on August 11, 1922 (The evening world., August 11, 1922, Latest Extra, Image 1). They divorced in 1931. About her relationship see e.g. The Manning times., August 23, 1922, Page 7 The Washington times., September 10, 1922, SUNDAY MORNING, Page 3 The former Mrs. Harold McCormick (Edith Rockefeller, divorced in 1921):
